TITLE: Turkey's inflation passes 75% in what economists believe is peak
SUMMARY: Inflation in Turkey topped 75% in May in what economists expect to be the peak before prices start to ease.

TITLE: OPEC+ wants concrete rate cuts before factoring impact on oil demand, Saudi energy minister says
SUMMARY: Expectations have mounted over the timeframe and number of rate cuts likely to be carried out by global central banks.

TITLE: The Fed’s preferred inflation measure rose 0.2% in April, as expected
SUMMARY: The personal consumption expenditures price index for April was expected to show an inflation rate of 2.7% over the past 12 months.

TITLE: Euro zone inflation rises to 2.6% in May, but bloc still seen heading for interest rate cut
SUMMARY: The European Central Bank is widely expected to cut interest rates next week.

TITLE: Fed's favorite inflation gauge is expected to show very slow progress on Friday
SUMMARY: The Commerce Department's measure of personal consumption expenditures prices is expected to show inflation in April running at a 2.7% annual rate.

TITLE: Global debt has grown to $315 trillion this year — here's how we got here
SUMMARY: The world is mired in $315 trillion of debt, according to a report from the Institute of International Finance.

TITLE: The Fed probably won't be delivering any interest rate cuts this summer
SUMMARY: Investors likely will have to sweat out a summer during which it looks increasingly unlikely that the Federal Reserve will be cutting interest rates.

TITLE: British retail sales plunge 2.3% in April, missing estimates
SUMMARY: U.K. retail sales volumes dropped 2.3% in April as wet weather deterred shoppers, the Office for National Statistics said Friday.

TITLE: Auto insurance rates are jumping the most since the 1970s, but there could be relief soon
SUMMARY: Soaring auto insurance costs have been a principle driver behind inflation over the past year, but there could be relief on the way.

TITLE: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon says can't rule out 'hard landing' for the U.S., stagflation will be 'worst outcome'
SUMMARY: Dimon said the worst outcome for the U.S. economy will be a "stagflation" scenario, where inflation continues to rise, but growth slows amid high unemployment.

TITLE: Fed officials seem like they have ‘no idea’ what is going on with U.S. inflation, strategist says
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve officials appear to have “no idea” what is happening when it comes to the inflation picture in the U.S., GAM's Julian Howard told CNBC.

TITLE: UK inflation comes in hotter than expected, slashing June rate cut bets
SUMMARY: The Office for National Statistics released inflation figures for April on Wednesday.

TITLE: Britain's inflation rate could be about to drop below the Bank of England's 2% target
SUMMARY: The headline inflation rate could be 'momentous,' but markets remain divided on the chance of a June cut and services will be the one to watch.

TITLE: Soaring debt and deficits causing worry about threats to the economy and markets
SUMMARY: Government debt that has swelled nearly 50% is capturing increasing worry both on Wall Street and in Washington.

TITLE: Some consumers are punting big purchases like pools and mattresses
SUMMARY: There are some signs that shoppers are holding off on big-ticket buys, the latest signal of the economy contracting at the hands of tighter monetary policy.

TITLE: Markets underestimate geopolitical risk as raft of elections looms, ECB's De Guindos says
SUMMARY: The European Central Bank's Financial Stability Report said that interest rate expectations have created the "potential for outsized market reactions."

TITLE: Europe must avoid ‘disaster’ of trade decoupling as it eyes China tariffs, EU's economics chief says
SUMMARY: "As far as Europe is concerned we need a more mature attitude in our trade," EU economics head Paolo Gentiloni told CNBC.

TITLE: CPI report shows inflation easing in April, with consumer prices still rising 3.4% from a year ago
SUMMARY: The consumer price index was expected to increase 3.4% from a year ago, according to the Dow Jones consensus estimate.

TITLE: Here's everything to expect from Wednesday's key report on inflation
SUMMARY: The Labor Department's Bureau of Labor Statistics will provide the consumer price index data Wednesday at 8:30 a.m. ET.

TITLE: Wholesale prices rose 0.5% in April, more than expected
SUMMARY: The producer price index was expected to increase 0.3% in April, according to the Dow Jones consensus estimate.

TITLE: Inflation outlook rises, fueled by expected increases for housing costs, New York Fed survey shows
SUMMARY: On a one-year basis, the expectation increased to 3.3%, up 0.3 percentage point from March and the highest since November 2023.

TITLE: Behind America's divided economy: Booming luxury travel and a jump in 'relief' loans
SUMMARY: Consumers are acting vastly different depending on income level.

TITLE: Consumer sentiment tumbles as inflation fears surge
SUMMARY: The University of Michigan Survey of Consumers posted a reading of 67.4 for May, down from 77.2 in April.

TITLE: Traders reassess Bank of England rate cuts as UK grows at fastest rate in nearly 3 years
SUMMARY: A slew of commentary from the Bank of England and a better-than-expected economic growth number have left traders and investors scrambling to refine their bets.

TITLE: UK economy emerges from recession with 0.6% growth in first quarter
SUMMARY: The U.K. economy has emerged from recession as gross domestic product rose 0.6% in the first quarter, beating expectations.

TITLE: The U.S. is now Germany’s biggest trading partner — taking over from China
SUMMARY: After years of China being Germany’s main trading partner, the U.S. quietly overtook that spot in the first quarter of the year, data calculations show.

TITLE: Weekly jobless claims jump to 231,000, the highest since August
SUMMARY: Jobless claims totaled a seasonally adjusted 231,000 for the week ending on May 4.

TITLE: Stanley Druckenmiller gives Biden's economic policies an 'F,' blames the Fed for reigniting inflation
SUMMARY: He called "Bidenomics" a failure and said consumers are paying the price in terms of higher inflation.

TITLE: Renters' hopes of being able to buy a home have fallen to a record low, New York Fed survey shows
SUMMARY: The share of renters who believe that they one day will be able to afford a home, fell to a record low 13.4%.

TITLE: Immigrant workers are helping boost the U.S. labor market
SUMMARY: The government predicts that the influx of immigrant workers will grow gross domestic product over the next decade by $7 trillion.
